intro: Rondeletia stachyoidea, commonly known as the velvetleaf rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in a fine, velvety texture. Rondeletia stachyoidea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in tropical climates.
